author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock] This package is named after the algorithm ISOKANN, as published in [[1]](https://pubs.aip.org/aip/jmp/article/65/1/013502/2933145/Learning-Koopman-eigenfunctions-of-stochastic), [[2]](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/00268976.2024.2356748), [[3]](http://arxiv.org/abs/2404.10523), [[4]](https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0015132).

I believe there is no risk of confusion with the existing Isoband and kindly request a manual merge.
Thank you!

[noblock] Name similarities do not require manual merging, but you will have to unblock [your comment](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/108387#issuecomment-2152691861) by adding `[noblock]`.
Blocking: We’ll probably go with https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/108243 after all

> Blocking: We’ll probably go with #108243 after all

That would be my preferred soluation as well.

body:

title: New package: Isokann v0.1.0
